body.section: The IHTSDO Workbench is launched from the self-launching icon, which can be found in the IHTSDO Workbench folder on your computer hard drive, or in the Start menu (on Windows-based PCs.) The IHTSDO Workbench icon is shown in .
Click (or double-click) on the icon to launch IHTSDO Workbench. The next screen will prompt you to select your user profile, as shown in .

Click on the “boostrap.ace” or other appropriate profile and click Open. The Activity Viewer, which displays a graphic as the concepts and other system components are loaded, will display, as shown in .
When loading activity is finished, the Config dialog, shown in will display.
Enter your user name and password and click OK. The IHTSDO Workbench Editor window will display, as shown in .

body.section: The Main IHTSDO Workbench IDE window contains these primary sections or areas:

ul.li: Hierarchy View: The horizontal section of the window provides access to the available hierarchies, a visual representation of relationships between concepts.
Concept Work Area: Tools to view details about and modify concepts.
Search Function Panel: The lower section of the window provides access to a search tool to help you locate the concept to be modified or used.

section.title: Control buttons and toggles
section.p: Corresponding to the three main screen regions, there are 3 associated rows of buttons, which we will refer to as:-

ul.li: Main Toggle buttons - These toggle display panels on or off without initiating any other actions.
Right-hand buttons - These launch business process plugins or toggle the several right-hand panels on or off.
Bottom control buttons - These toggle the search or signpost panels. There is also a convenience "transporter" function located here.

section.title: Right-hand control buttons
section.p: The buttons on the top right of the IDE control a variety of IDE Business Process extensions (plugins), as well as giving access to the preferences panel.

p.b: Transporter Toggle Transporter Toggle toggle transporter

section.p: Provides a way to quickly populate one of the unassigned concept work area tabs, or to locate a concept in the hierarchy, using drag and drop.

p.b: Queue Viewer Toggle Queue Viewer Toggle toggle queue viewer

section.p: Displays or hides queues from which users can launch processes, including work assignments. For more information about using queue viewer features, .

p.b: Process Builder Toggle Process Builder Toggle toggle process builder

section.p: Displays or hides the Process Builder, where you can create or execute business processes using the concepts you modify, as shown . For more information about building processes, see .
If displayed, this button can execute a business process that will synchronize local data with a subversion repository.

Displays or hides the available hierarchy versions and other settings. In most environments, the project manager will set up and maintain preferences for each user, including the edit path. The preferences panel overlays the concept work area. Access to the taxonomy hierarchy is preserved, since many of the preferences are set or altered by dragging concepts from the taxonomy panel and dropping them into the appropriate tabbed pane of the preferences panel.

section.title: Bottom buttons
section.p: Toggles on/off the search pane. The contents of the search pane are preserved intact. The button simply shows or hides the view of the pane.

Toggles on/off the Signpost pane. The signpost pane is an area that can be utilised by various plugins to display a variety of information in a variety of formats. The contents of the signpost pane are preserved intact. The button simply shows or hides the view of the pane.

This special button, also known as the "lightning bolt", behaves differently to most buttons in the IDE. A concept can be dragged onto the button and then transported (copied) to one of a number of alternative locations within the IDE. The destination is chosen using the dialog that appears when the concept is dropped on the transporter.
